cab.content: In compliance with the decision of the Cabinet at our meeting on March 20th, I have consulted the Law Officers as to whether the powers of the Board of Trade in Section 2 (S) of the Safeguarding of Industries Act, 1921, are permissive or obligatory. Their opinion is appended. (Initialled) S.B.28th March, 1922. SAFEGUARDING OF INDUSTRIES ACT, 1921. 0 P I N I ON of The Law Officers of The Crown and Mr. W. Bowstead. We are of opinion that the power to make an Order under section 2 (3) of the Act is discretionary. (Signed) Ernest M. Pollock (Signed) Leslie Scott. (Signed) W. Bowstead.Law Officers' Department. 23rd March, 1922.THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENT.SECRET,- CABINETCP. 3898. ------..... SAFEGUARDING OF INDUSTRIES ACT.. PART II. Note by the President of the Board of Trade.
